data.title: Voice of America (VOA News)
data.meta_description: Sarah Zaman is the Pakistan Bureau Chief for the Voice of America, based in Islamabad. Prior to the appointment, Sarah served as interim managing editor for web and digital platforms, editor, anchor, interim executive producer, and reporter for 15 years in VOA's Urdu Service in Washington D.C....
data.text:
Can Afghan Taliban Fight Pakistani Military?

Taliban have a formidable doctrine of asymmetric warfare involving suicide bombers and contingents of locals willing to drop shovels and grab guns, experts say

US Diplomat Denies Pushing Pakistani PM Khan Out of Office

Donald Lu tells a House hearing the accusations are false, and reporting of a secret diplomatic cable alleging his role is inaccurate

We Don't Want Armed Conflict With Afghanistan, Pakistani Defense Minister Tells VOA

Asif warned that Islamabad could block the corridor it provides to landlocked Afghanistan for trade with India

Pakistani School Focuses on Healing Generational Trauma

In a neighborhood that was once a hotbed of gang violence in Pakistan's economic hub, Karachi, one school is focused on healing the wounds of trauma passed down through generations. VOA Pakistan bureau chief Sarah Zaman has the story. Camera: Wajid Asad.

X Remains Restricted in Pakistan a Week After Suspension

Services were suspended following a high-level official’s declaration that he was involved in election rigging

UN Conference on Afghanistan Begins Without Taliban

The Taliban were also invited to Doha for the meetings, however, the group opted not to attend, saying certain conditions weren’t met

Taliban Refuse to Attend UN Conference on Afghanistan

In a statement, the de facto rulers say their conditions for attending the international gathering were not met

Pakistan's Election Results Send Message to Powerful Military, Say Observers

Results of Pakistan's February 8 elections show candidates backed by former Pakistani prime minister Imran Khan winning the most seats in the national assembly. But the results might not push the military to give up its hold on the political landscape. Sarah Zaman reports from Lahore, Pakistan.

Loyalists of Pakistan’s Jailed Ex-PM Khan Are Frontrunners in Contentious Election

There are widespread allegations of an attempt by interim government to rig polls

Pakistanis Vote Amid Mistrust in Electoral Process

Pakistanis voted Thursday for provincial and national assemblies. VOA’s Pakistan bureau chief Sarah Zaman spoke with voters in Lahore, who expressed a mix of disappointment and hope as the country reels from political and economic instability amid mistrust in the electoral process.

Pakistan Heads to Polls Amid Political and Economic Crises

Pakistan is set to hold general elections on February 8. A military-backed crackdown on former Prime Minister Imran Khan's party has cast doubts on the fairness of the polls.

Transgender Candidate Hopes to Make History at Pakistani Polls

Three transgender people are on Pakistan's ballot for provincial and national assemblies next week. Rights activist Nayyab Ali is among them, running for a national assembly seat from the nation's capital, Islamabad. VOA's Pakistan bureau chief Sarah Zaman reports. Camera: Wajid Asad

Tradition Keeps Women From Voting in Pakistani Village

Years before the creation of Pakistan, village elders in Dhurnal vowed women would not go out to vote. That promise, made in a mosque, was renewed in the 60s
